EmailTemplate.subject: eWeekly –Ghost Kitchens Pros and Cons
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
December 10, 2020 Rise of Ghost Kitchens: Pros and Cons The proliferation of contactless technology - mobile pay, delivery apps - in combination with consumer concerns about safety, are among the many factors contributing to the surge in online delivery to the tune of $45 billion this year alone. As restaurant operators adapt their business models to support this trend, many are exploring ghost kitchens and other delivery options as a cost-effective alternative to help them remain competitive.
In a recent article, The Rise of Ghost Kitchens and the Impact on Contactless Delivery <[[https://www.qsrmagazine.com/outside-insights/rise-ghost-kitchens-and-impact-contactless-delivery]]>, Rakesh Patel, Executive Director of NCR Hospitality, discusses “the different ghost kitchen models, their pros and cons and the importance of technology these facilities use to drive customer experience and revenue.” Share this article with your customers to help them decide if a ghost kitchen is the right strategy to expand their business.
Migration of Aloha Online Ordering to the Public Cloud The migration of Aloha Online Ordering to the public cloud will be completed for all impacted sites on December 15, 2020. A communication was sent to the remaining customers that are migrating in the last phase on December 15th, explaining the administrative changes they must complete to access Web Admin and Menu Configurator after their Aloha Online Ordering site has been migrated. If you receive any questions from customers, please share these detailed instructions <[[https://ncr.quickbase.com/up/bqe6gx23b/g/rbn/ek/va/Aloha Online Azure Cloud Migration.docx]]> with them about actions that must be completed to ensure there is no disruption after their site is migrated.
